lexUnit.name: slide.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: change gradually to a lower level

sentence.text: Investment trust money flowed back into blue chips such as Sony , Honda and Pioneer , but banks , financials and government bonds continued to slide .
More important , buyers with 95 per cent loans who may have seen the price of their property slide in recent months could end up with a debt greater than the value of the property .
But do n't sell just because the price starts to slide .
Investors of public-sector funds , mainly trust banks , have taken exhaustive measures to prevent share prices from sliding during the extended vacation .
Pressure mounts as Bond shares slide to 10-year low
BOND CORPORATION shares slid to a 10-year low yesterday as pressure intensified on the beleaguered Australian group .
The grey market resumed on May 12th , after the rights issue was priced ; the shares slid further .
Pre-tax profits after exceptional items slid by 5% to £902m .
Although average prices across the country are rising moderately from their levels of a year ago , in the South-east they have slid by 10 to 15 per cent in the past 12 months .
Torquay has moved into second spot , with Bournemouth sliding from runner-up in 1991 to sixth this year .
Then Alan Igglesden took five for 34 as Warwickshire slid to 121 for five -- still 482 behind .
AQUASCUTUM held sales only a hairsbreadth short of the corresponding figure at £23.6million in the six months to July 31 , but pre-tax profit slid to £616,000 , from £809,000 .
Bond plunge : Shares in Bond Corporation slid to a 10-year low at one point valuing the beleaguered Australian group at less than £50m .
